title: The Hawaiian story of the wind keepers - Sydney Iaukea

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the Hawaiian wind goddess who wielded a gourd that housed the winds of the Islands?
Who were the two seafaring navigators that plotted against Paka'a?

options.label: D
options.text: The fishermen appointed by the two treacherous navigators

multiple-choice.question: Where did Paka'a flee to after being stripped of his land and privileges?
What was the name of Paka'a's son who was taught the way of the winds by his father?
What was the purpose of Kuapaka'a's plan to test the king's loyalty and dedication?

options.label: A
options.text: To avenge his father and restore his rightful place beside the king

options.label: B
options.text: To create a storm that forced the king's fleet to shelter on Moloka'i

options.label: C
options.text: To use his powers to test the king's commitment

options.label: D
options.text: To prove his skills as a wind god

multiple-choice.question: What did Kuapaka'a do to test the king's commitment?

options.label: A
options.text: He created a storm that forced the king's fleet to shelter on Moloka'i

options.label: B
options.text: He used his powers to test the king's dedication

options.label: C
options.text: He anchored the canoe and passed provisions to everyone

options.label: D
options.text: He brightened the sky and sailed towards Hawaii Island

multiple-choice.question: What was the wager that Kuapaka'a proposed to the fishermen who had been appointed by the two treacherous navigators?

options.label: A
options.text: His catch of flying fish against that they had caught

options.label: C
options.text: His knowledge of the winds against theirs

multiple-choice.question: What did the king ask Kuapaka'a to do after hearing that eight of his fishermen were to die?

options.label: C
options.text: To restore Paka'a's lands and position

options.label: D
options.text: To test his loyalty and dedication

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the canoe race between Kuapaka'a and the fishermen who had been appointed by the two treacherous navigators?
What was the final outcome of the story?

options.label: A
options.text: Paka'a was stripped of his land and privileges

options.label: B
options.text: The king's seafaring navigators were forgiven

options.label: C
options.text: Kuapaka'a was welcomed home by the king

options.label: D
options.text: The story ended with a cliffhanger
